alert.note: Alert for Gadsden; Jackson (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 08 at 7:24PM EDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of east central Jackson, Gadsden, Decatur, southwestern Grady and southeastern Seminole Counties through 815 PM EDT/715 PM CDT/... At 723 PM EDT/623 PM CDT/, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 7 miles east of Donalsonville to 7 miles northwest of Chattahoochee. Movement was southeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Bainbridge, Quincy, Havana, Whigham, Greensboro, West Bainbridge, Chattahoochee, Sneads, Gretna, Attapulgus, Climax, Brinson, Douglas City, Florence, Jamieson, Recovery, Laingkat, Calvary, Quincy Airport and Nickleville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
